item.title: Child with low self-esteem
item.description: Child with low self-esteem has specific characteristics and we will find them in this post and take a look at your child what he or she has.
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
Child with low self-esteem

In general, children with well-developed self-esteem have a stable level of self-esteem, whereas children with low self-esteem often change their level of self-esteem. Depending on the situation, self-esteem increases or decreases rapidly.

In this case, you have to go through a high level of self-esteem several times and help build a stable self-esteem for your child. Of course, just because you see something like the one below doesn't mean your child has a big problem.

It is an important time when you should observe your child a little more and help the child feel more positive and confident.

Here are most representative characteristics of child with low self-esteem.

They are afraid of Failure

If they feel like they are going to lose, they stop or give up because they are afraid of failure. Even if they compete, they think giving up is better than losing. They think, "I gave up on purpose." and give up like that creates the thought of  ‘It is okay because I am not lost.’.

They don't challenge things likely to fail

Children with high self-esteem are not afraid of failure and challenge things whereas children with low self-esteem do not challenge at all because they are afraid of failure. It is because the frustration of failure is so loud and scary. They hope they have only successful memories in their memory.

The result is more important than the process

When they work, they think that whatever the process is, only the result needs to be good. Because the most important thing for them is successful result rather than hard work and experiences.

Shortcut is ok If the result is good

If the result can be good, they think the shortcut in the process is okay. If you take a child solving a problem book for example, you can see it well. Children with high self-esteem focus on the ability to solve problems, regardless of the severity or amount of the problem. If there is a wrong problem, they look closely at it, and they go over the front to see why they are wrong.

However, children with low self-esteem focus on completing the problem book quickly or on the number of circles. they focus on what they can show others. Therefore, they increase the number of circles by looking at the answers and solving them or by correcting the wrong answer when grading.

Play more than necessary to hide the frustration

They hate letting others know of a failed situation and cannot stand the frustration. They try to pass over their desire to escape with a joke or something else. They want to divert their attention by playing around.

They are seen putting off what they have to do

When they are afraid that they will fail, they tend to put off work and try to create a situation where they don't have to.

They push others to hide their inadequacies

They re extremely reluctant to reveal their low self-esteem, failing situation, or inadequacy. It is because it is scary that others will be frustrated again when they learn about themselves. That is why they act to push others or deliberately show exaggeration.

They don't admit reality in adverse circumstances

When a situation is unfavorable to them, they often don't admit the reality and talk about other situations.

Make excuses in advance

If the result is not good, they make excuses or say less importance for poor result, such as saying, ‘I didn’t care about this very much, so I purposely avoided it.’

The result is returned to other people

When the outcome of work is not good, the responsibility is returned to the environment or to someone else in order for them to avoid being criticized for their responsibilities.

Other characteristics

Other characteristics act to appease others, constantly check for love, or care very much about the gaze of others. A child with high self-esteem and well developed self-esteem can make rational and proactive decisions and cope well with negative psychology. However, children with low self-esteem cannot bear to experience failure, so they keep trying to avoid it. But you also have to be careful if your self-esteem is excessive. If you have excessive self-esteem,'I'm good at everything. Because there is a possibility of falling into the supremacy of "I am superior".

It is observing what your children are saying and about presenting a very simple frustrating situation such as asking them to listen to something and giving them a toy that is still difficult for children to do and seeing what they will say after a failure. In contrast, children with low self-esteem say things like "So I said I could not or look I thought I chould not."

In the next post, we will find a way to improve or develop self-esteem.

See you soon!

item.title: Child with high self-esteem
item.description: Child with high self-esteem has several characteristics, such as being like to have new relationships with new people, empathy, consideration, kind, polite, satisfaction, like new things, passionate, positive way of thinking, using positive words
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
What about the level of self-esteem for my child, the belief that I can and love myself? Is my child a child with low self-esteem? A child with high self-esteem?
Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of child you are!

Child with high self-esteem

As discussed in the previous post of people with high esteem, the characteristics of people with high were listed and now we will look child with high self-esteem through and through in this post.

What about the level of self-esteem of your child? Is your child a child with high or low self-esteem? Is it a high child? Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of  your child is.

A child with high self-esteem has following characteristics. If your child has more than 6 characteristics below, you can think of him or her as having high-esteem overall.

No fear to have relationships with other people

They don’t have any fear of having relationships with other people. Children with high self-esteem are not afraid to talk to new people because they are confident that other people will also like themselves.

Empathy and consideration

Self-respect can also lead to others. They already know that the relationship through empathy and consideration is very stable. It is because they learned the attitude or method of maintaining a good relationship through the successful relationships they have been through.

Kind and polite

They are kind and polite. They learn how to communicate with others by seeing what other people are doing to them. They learn the kind and polite aspects they have received, and they do it same.

Satisfaction

They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge new things.

New things

They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

Passionate

They try to do things proactively and proactively. When they do things, they don't act passively and passively. They always try to be proactive and take the initiative.

Positive way of thinking

They are not good at negative thoughts. They focus on the current situation. What if this doesn't work? What if this goes wrong? Instead of being restless, they enjoy and focus on the current situation. Even if they have negative thoughts, they think they can quickly come up with a countermeasure or try harder.

Positive words

They don't use pessimistic words well and words that deny reality or pessimistic words. They express themselves with positive words.

Responsibility

They put the responsibility of work on themselves and think that they are responsible for doing something. If they are making a big house out of blocks and it doesn't work well, they think that they will just need a little more and keep challenging or they guess they tried to make it too big. Then they will think "shall we change it a little bit more?"

Never frustrated

They are not very frustrated if they fail something. Even if they fail and suffer frustration, they won't get hurt very much. They just think of ways to overcome failures. Because they know that with a little more effort, they can experience other successes.

What is the result of the level of your child for self-esteem with above features? In the next post, the characteristics of child with low self-esteem will be introduced.

item.title: People with low self-esteem
item.description: If 'pride' arises from interactions with other people, then 'self-esteem' has to be found within yourself. Rather than an objective and neutral judgment, it has a strong feeling of subjectiveness.
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
Self-esteem is the concept of recognizing that you are good and deserving of attention. People with high self-esteem can establish their identity properly in their lives. This is because high self-esteem allows you to confidently challenge and achieve whatever you do.

On the other hand, people with low self-esteem often have difficulty doing anything. Self-esteem and pride are often confused. However, the difference is that self-esteem means affirmation of what it is as it is, whereas pride means affirmation in competition.

If 'pride' arises from interactions with other people, then 'self-esteem' has to be found within yourself. Rather than an objective and neutral judgment, it has a strong feeling of subjectiveness.

“You are useless.”

How do you feel when you read this sentence? are you feeling very bad, do you want to refute, or is it just seen as part of the sentence? The more you naturally understand after hearing that, the less self-esteem you may be. Low self-esteem means that you value yourself low. That is why you think that you are incompetent and useless.

On the other hand, people with high self-esteem will react in two ways when they are told that they are useless.

One thing is to defend yourself and you list your strengths and strengths, and for this reason, you will think and say that you are never useless.

Another thing is that when you hear such a statement, you don't react because you already know that you are useless, and you don't even feel the need to react.

If you feel that more than one of the lists below is true, your self-esteem is most likely to be low.

Here are general characteristics of people with low self-esteem.

People with low self-esteem

They care too much what people think

They often think about what other people think if I act like this and they ignore me.

Their own way of interpreting

Just laughing at them feels like they have already been attacked. They think about what others say and give meaning to it.

They can't believe you compliment them

They don't like it and doubt it even when they praise it.

They can't make eye contact

When they are talking to someone, if they make eye contact for a moment, they willl stutter.

My fault if others get angry

If my friend with me is in a bad mood, I wonder if I'm in a bad mood, so I look back on my behavior.

I'm depressed even once pointed out

When criticized, they fall into the end of depression, and even a few of their motivation disappears.

Easily swayed by what others say

They believes in everything they hear and they think everything others say is more correct than them.

No self-assertion

They say "I hate it but I can’t say I don’t like it"

Afraid of new challenges

They think it would be better to do what I always do as the image of failing before they even challenge is drawn in their mind.

They belittle themselves

They compare themselves to others and blame themselves for not liking them.

People with low self-esteem are more likely to be wielded by the opinions of others. It's because they put the standard of value judgment outside themselves, not inside them. You will lower your abilities and the outcomes you have achieved by meeting the standards of others. There are many people who look at'How will other people see me?' and think,'If you know me deeply, you will be disappointed.'‌‌People with low self-esteem also have severe emotional fluctuations. The reason is clear. You can protect your self-esteem by focusing on the opinions of others who have hurt your feelings, because it is difficult because you do not believe in yourself. It is easy to understand when you think of a boat that is not properly centered. Because it is not centered, it stumbles even in a brief shower and sinks in shallow waves.

Also, people with low self-esteem think that they are toxic. Others seem to have a different meaning to them even if they just laugh, and for some reason, they think that others will judge me badly. Even if they succeed in any job, they cannot be happy. I feel anxious despite being happy, thinking that happiness now will not last long. Rather, they easily get used to the experience of failure rather than success. Looking at the collapse of myself, I think that I knew this would happen because my value was originally low.

This low self-esteem is a big problem in life. This is because it affects the people around you, not just your own problems. Lack of respect and love for yourself means that there is something inside that is not filled. Everyone has a tendency to fill in what is lacking. So, people with low self-esteem turn to the outside to fill in the empty inside. You want to get love and attention from others, but it's like pouring water into the poison underneath. I try to fill the poison that keeps draining, so no matter how much I pour it, it's not enough. The more loved you receive, the more you will want from the other person. Furthermore, they want to meet the perfect person who does not hurt them, who unconditionally fits their needs.

But there is no such person in the world. Because everyone lives by instinct for their own satisfaction as independent beings. No one was born to fit someone perfectly. Because you want other people to have a heart that you can't fill yourself with, you continue to hurt others and hurt yourself.

Let's discuss child with high self-esteem in the next post.‌‌

item.title: People with high self-esteem
item.description: When you see happy people regardless of the environment, they have their own characteristics. It is that they have the power to be grateful for even the smallest things.
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
When you see happy people regardless of the environment, they have their own characteristics. They have the power to be grateful for even the smallest things.

Let's talk about the characteristics and commonalities of people with high self-esteem. Self-esteem affects our lives more than we think and can make us more positive and energetic. as posted earlier, self-esteem is a heart to respect one's dignity, love one's self, and respect one's self. The smaller the size of this mind is, the easier it is to be shaken by the wrods and circumstances of the people around you and hurt yourself without your knowledge.

If so, let's think about what characteristics of people with high self-esteem have in common.

People with high self-esteem

Don't depend

People with high self-esteem never depend. As your heart to seek recognition and empathy from the other person is increased, your dependence will eventually increase. Efforts to build yourself up is more important than the stability gained by depending on the other person.

Not afraid of mistakes

Everyone makes mistakes. We learn and grow from mistakes, but people with low self-esteem are busy blaming themselves for mistakes. When we work thinking that no one is perfect, mistakes become a factor that grows us.

Don't be afraid of rejection

In life, there are cases when you ask someone to ask for it. People with high self-esteem are not hurt even if they are rejected by the other person. If I have the right to make an offer to the other person, the other person has the right to decline the offer. Most people don't refuse because they hate you.

Acknowledge your weaknesses

People have many weaknesses. Rather than trying to hide your weaknesses, you need to be confident and accept them. If you admit your weaknesses as they are, weaknesses can turn into strengths. People with low self-esteem see only weaknesses in themselves.

Don't care about others' eyes

People with high self-esteem do not confine themselves to public appraisal. You don't care how others see you, you just do your job. He refers to other people's opinions, but only if he is not influenced, he can live his own life. We have the right to choose our own life and live independently.

Don't blame

If you have low self-esteem, it's easy to attribute the cause to others. You are responsible for what you decide. People with high self-esteem are never to blame. They know how to accept the results, take them humbly, and try to do the next job.

Don't misrepresent the other person

People with low self-esteem are busy trying to misrepresent others if they don't misrepresent themselves. Conversely, a person with high self-esteem appreciates and praises the other person's strengths. Looking at the bad points, it is easy to see only the endless bad parts. People who love me don't hate others.

Not very angry

People with strong self-esteem do not get angry. I am not easily hurt by what others say, and I rarely get angry after all. When you're angry, focus on resolving your feelings and ask,'Is this really something that makes you angry?' I worry. A person with weak self-esteem gets angry when he has a strong heart to protect himself.

Like new things

People with high self-esteem make life decisions according to their will. He is not afraid of new things and has the courage to pioneer. He doesn't get all the results he wants by buying a new job. However, a person with high self-esteem only lives with his or her life at risk.

Don't obsess over self-esteem

Those who succeed objectively do not necessarily have high self-esteem. Self-esteem can be low or high depending on the situation. The self-esteem built up by force is unsettling. It is better to recognize and love the way you are, rather than trying to increase your self-esteem.

Let's talk about people with low self-esteem in the next post.

item.title: Self-esteem
item.description: People generally say that high-self-esteem makes people think in a positive way and everything goes well because of the high-self-esteem. On the contrary, low-self-esteem makes people think in a negative way which makes everything goes not well. What's self-esteem?
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
What is self-esteem?

Self-esteem is the feeling of accepting yourself positively by thinking that you are valuable and keeping the high dignity of yourself. In other words, it means that you self-evaluate yourself, your value, abilitiese and aptitudes positively and love yourself. Those who have positive feelings toward themselves are generally positive toward others, whereas those who view themselves negatively are generally said to be negative toward others.

If we want to live a worthwhile life, there are things we must do. it is respect and love yourself. Those who hate themselves can do nothing of value, and people who don't know that they are loved and precious are busy to take a pessimistic view of life and the world.

These days, a feeling of hatred for you and others replaces your self-esteem. Those who fail to hate others blame and demean themselves. A distorted mind only ruins themselves.

They think that only matter and wealth are the whole world, and if they can't have it, they dismiss it as unhappy. Economic conditions do not make our lives happy. Diverse lives enrich us, and our existence alone can be respected. What we need in the present is self-esteem.

Let's look at the characteristics of people with high self-esteem in next post.

item.title: sudo without password
item.description: I use my intel NUC, Raspberry Pi and iMac alone and feel aways inconvenience to enter password when I run sudo command. Here I like to introduce how to run sudo without password and pkexec use case.
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
Super user do called sudo in Linux and macOS  is to run commands or programs as root user. When you use sudo in terminal it is required to enter password every time that I really don't like because it is not convenient, but there could be a reason  why password is rquired to enter in sudo every time. (maybe security reason..I guess)

Linux

  1. open terminal

2. edit the /etc/sudoers file by typing visudo command

sudo visudo

3. append the following entry to run all commands without a password

4. reboot

reboot

macOS

This for Linux also works in macOS as well.

  1. open terminal

2. edit the /etc/sudoers file by typing visudo command

sudo visudo

3. append the following entry to run all commands without a password

user ID ALL=(ALL) NOPASSSD:ALL

4. reboot

reboot

Trouble shooting

In case that sudo cannot be executed caused by syntax error, use pkexec. pkexec allows an authorized user to execute program as another user.
  1. execute pkexec to run visudo as another user to correct syntax error
pkexec visudo

2. find and fix error

item.title: How to control being talkative
item.description: "Once spoken, it can not be taken back." Are you a very talkative person who wants to control being talkative?
item.dc:creator: Daegyun Na
item.content:encoded:
I think people looking for a hint or solution on same topic would have a similar mind or characteristic and hope this post can help you currently reading this post control being talkative because I also read this post in order for myself to improve how to control being talkative and to search my heart.

Think about what you want to say

Before you speak, you need to be aware of what you intend to do. The same goes for doing things, not words. Whatever you say or do, you have an intention to do it. Rather than being dragged by my unconscious feelings and thoughts, I asked myself, "Why do I want to say that?" And look.

We as humans have metacognition which is a function of the frontal lobe in the brain and developed by practice and meditation only in humans. In other words, we can only recognize and worry about ourselves.

When negative words are gushed out of negative emotions and thoughts, we gush out with a strong desire to speak with a flood of negative words. It is not talking but it is about letting negative emotions and thoughts. On the other hand, when you say positive words, you are not in a hurry.

‌‌If you are in negative, You have to check why and fix it. Since humans have an animal body, their aggression increases when their basic needs are not met. For example, you will lose your rational apprearance like an hungry animal if you are hungry.

Words to avoid

Blaming and Gossiping

Blaming and gossiping are one's inner problem projected outward. The way people treat themselves is consistent with all aspects of human relationships with others. People who have a mind to blame themselves are good at blaming others. That is they blame others because they have the lack of their self-esteem and don't know how to love themselves. Even they have a sense of damage that others blame and ignore them. As a result, they have strong pretense to dress up and a fear that people will ignore them unless wear good clothes and carries expensive items.

In order to solve the habit of blaming others and gossiping, you will have to solve the problem of self-esteem and self-love. Whenever you feel attacking yourself, you need to be aware that it is a delusion and let go, and you need to practice to see yourself energetically and positively.

In addition, the practice of feeling and expressing unconditional love for others such as family is also effective. At the subconscious level, since I and others are not distinguished, love for others is the same as love for me. Practice expressing love and gratitude every day. Regardless of what happens, interpret it positively, give reasons for gratitude, compliment me, and write it down.

Here is an example encouraging me.

‌‌I have to wait because I missed the bus. Thanks to it I can spend my spare time thinking about future plan. I thank myself for having a free time for myself. I am lovely who knows how to use and enjoy even a short time.‌‌

Judging others

Judging others is also similar to blame and gossip. This is what I say because I think that person's behavior seems strange from my perspective and I think I can't understand. The word 'judgment' in our language has many neutral meanings like 'wise judgment', so the word 'judgment' would be close to the word 'judging'.

Right and wrong are relative, so each person is different. The food you enjoy can cause allergies to others, and what is right for you can be wrong for others. No matter how rational and natural it is to do this from my point of view, it may not be so to others. Unless you are in the position of another person, unless you are a person who has lived the same as that person, you are not entitled to judge and look at whatever way that person lives. No one has the right to judge others. Whatever life it is, it will have to be affirmed.

Of course, it is very important to keep order and not harm others in a society where many people live. Therefore, if it is a legal matter, they will interfere with each other, but if not, there is no need to intervene. When it comes to things that don't hurt others, you shouldn't say anything like this or that, no matter how the other person lives, and when such thoughts come up, you should look back.

‌‌Even if it is a problem based on one's own values, I cannot force my perspective on others. It is the person's life, and that person will be responsible for that person's actions. With the attitude of Let it be, you will need to know how to encourage the person how they live.

‌‌The psychological reason for making judgmental words is that they also have a habit of judging themselves, so it is projected to the outside. When you think for yourself, it's good to think in a way of 'Meeting Me'. The way of conveying me is to say the subject of every sentence starting with me. Even when you're thinking alone, using this way makes it easier to reflect on you. Next, if you think about putting 'I' in all the objects in the sentence, your psychological problems will be revealed. This is called 'subject to change'. Changing the subject reveals my core beliefs, which are often stereotypes. Therefore, try to revise that part. Through this process, we can solve the subconscious complex.

Practice to think outside the box

That person is fat.
I think that person is fat.
I hate that he is fat. (Method of communication)
Why did I think that way? (subject to change)
I hate that I am fat.
Why do I hate being fat?
Fat is because it is ugly. (Heavenly believe)
Is it true that fat things are ugly? (Thinking from different angles)
No. Being fat is relative, and appearance cannot represent a person's worth.
It is just an individual characteristic. Both fat people and skinny people are equally precious souls. Other people's appearance has nothing to do with me, and my appearance is just an appearance.
Therefore, it is a wrong idea to focus on your appearance and feel like or dislike. I am a precious person as I am.
That person is arrogant and likes to show off. (Method of communication)










Lament as energy vampire

When you lament with complaining, you will also  gossip. It is a way in which people with a sense of victim consciousness slander and resent others and assert their innocence. It is a way of showing yourself up by showing that someone else has done something wrong and thinking you are the victim. This is an egoistic way of thinking and to look at the world only from one's point of view and look at the world separately from others.

If I try to understand the position of others like me, I will not claim only my harm. If you think about the other person's position as a reverse point, the sense of damage will disappear, and even if you have suffered obvious damage, a feeling of compassion will arise.

Complaints such as gossip takes away the energy of the listener and make them mentally confused. This is called an energy vampire. Blaming third parties while making the person in front of me tired, and at the same time reinforcing one's own ego leads to a triple obsession. Personally, I also struggle with this habit. In order to get out of the habit of complaining,  you have to look back on yourself every moment. 'am I trying to complain about it right now? Let's pause. If you say something like this, the person you hear will be painful.' You should be aware of this and try to solve it yourself when you are alone.

The reason why you complain is that you cover up your own problems without looking into them. When I meet the right person, my mouth becomes irritated and I gossip and resent me while talking about myself. I should try to reduce the consciousness of damage inside me and get rid of resentment, hatred, and anger.

To do that, you have to think from the person's point of view, not just from my standpoint. Claiming that I've been harmed may be unintentional, or it may be that I overdo it. The fundamental reason why you resent others is because you don't have your own inner strength and confidence.

If I focus on my hope, will, and passion in my life and live faithfully, I have no time to blame others. In other words, because the mental power was not used in the right direction, the surplus power is revealed as a power to blame others.

'That person made my life like this. That person made me difficult.' Through this thought, I want to protect my incompetence. Even the thought of 'I am incompetent' is mistaken.

If I could just love myself the way I am, all this would melt. If you love me the way you are, do not obsess over the gaze of others, and live dreaming of what you want to do what comes out of you, there is no reason to meddle in and interfere with others' affairs, and there is no reason to blame and resent my work. Those who love myself and live for my dreams will love and respect others as well.

Too much explaining myself

Explaining myself is a little different from lament, but similar. Rationalizing and neglecting my faults without acknowledging my faults, it is different from looking at myself positively and encouraging them. The two should not be confused. If you rationalize one's fault after committing an obvious mistake, something that hurts others, human relationships will collapse and your soul will not progress. Words to avoid with excuses, words that try to escape the situation and get out like a loach, irresponsible words, and such words are also not to be said.

Bragging and bluffing

We should also refrain from bragging words. You can see what level of pride you should avoid. Before you speak, check what kind of mind you are. There is a lack of self-esteem, on the contrary, to boast of oneself as if something is anxious. People don't have to say things that are too obvious. When it comes to finding and showing something to be proud of, there is a desire to receive recognition and attention from others, which means you have not recognized and loved yourself. If you love yourself, you won't brag or brag about it.

You don't even have to say anything that describes your future plans. You just need to be yourself and show it. When you speak, energy leaks out, and you actually lose the mental power to administer to the process. In fact, you do everything you have to do with words. Such a person speaks as if he would do anything, but he doesn't really do anything and does nothing for others. 'If I succeed later, I'll help my parents.' Instead of saying this, you just need to help your parents in reality right away. 'Honey, I'll make a lot of money next time and spend a lot of overseas trips.' It is better not to say this, but to wash the dishes at least once in reality. The type of saying 'I'll do it well later' is just an attempt to evade responsibility now.

​'I have a business plan like this.' 'I am going to get a job by passing the exam.' There is really no need to explain these words to others. No one is interested in other people's life plans. Do not waste your energy by explaining it to others, but it is something you should try to do with yourself.

Rationalization and excuses, bluffing and bragging, explaining future plans, all are not true to themselves. Such a person cannot treat himself sincerely and lives by creating countless fake images. Creating and showing self-images by posting all kinds of photos on social media also shows that it is not true. I haven't been able to meet the true-self within me. If we meet the true-self through meditation or self-reflection, we do not have to worry about what we see and defend ourselves to others. Being truthful, not deceived from me, is key to spiritual growth. You will have to know your true-self and make friends with me and live a clear and transparent life.

‌‌Meaningful silence is always better than meaningless words.
‌‌Before making any guesswork, find out the facts.
